interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Cedarmont Kids - Toddler Tunes [DVD]
Review Date: 2014/04/29
Store: Children  (Actor),     Gary Musick  (Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Music Videos & Concerts
Product Description: ['English & Spanish Versions!', "Give your kids the gift of song! Jam-packed with best-loved, classic children's songs, this live-action collection offers hours of wholesome, interactive fun. Your children will sing and dance along with these all-time favorites - performed by the famous Cedarmont Kids - over and over again. They'll love Sing-Along-Songs! and so will you!", '25 Back-to-Back Music Videos for Kids!The Wheels on the Bus - The Alphabet Song - Polly, Put the Kettle On - God Made Me - Eensy, Weensy Spider - The More We Get Together - Six Little Ducks - Baa, Baa, Black Sheep - Roll Over - Father, We Thank Thee - Are You Sleeping? - Jack and Jill - Oh Where, Oh Where Has My Little Dog Gone? - Get on Board - Oh Dear! What Can The Matter Be? - Pop! Goes the Weasel! - This Old Man - London Bridge - Mary Had a Little Lamb - The Muffin Man - Row, Row, Row Your Boat - Deep and Wide - Mulberry Bush - Old MacDonald - Be Kind to Your Web-footed Friends', 'DVD Bonus Features: English or Spanish language options available, in stereo, with subtitled sing-along lyrics! Split track audio lets you sing along with Cedarmont Kids or by yourself with the music Plus, cast and production notes - 30 minutes']
Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family', 'Format': 'Color, DVD, Live, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Gary Musick, Children', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.4 x 0.6 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Gary Musick', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Live, NTSC', 'Run time': '35 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 30, 2002', 'Actors': 'Children', 'Studio': 'Time Life (Ventura)', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: The kids loves the songs and they run, play,dance and jump around to the music and singing. They have lots of fun.
Review Title: Grandkids
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Hatfields & McCoys [Blu-ray]
Kevin Costner  (Actor, Producer),     Bill Paxton  (Actor),     Kevin Reynolds  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Drama
['Bonded by their oath to the same flag, two confederate soldiers, “Devil” Anse Hatfield (Kevin Costner) and Randall McCoy (Bill Paxton), return home seeking peace after tireless months of battle. Their expectations are quickly shattered when a murder based on misunderstandings and an illicit love affair trigger warfare between former comrades and their clans. This historic feud teeters on the brink of an all out civil war as friends and neighbors join opposing sides in a rivalry that would ultimately shape American History.']
{'Genre': 'Drama, History', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Noel Fisher, Hatfield and McCoy Productions, LLC, Matt Barr, Jena Malone, Sarah Parish, Bill Paxton, Sam Reid, Kevin Costner, Jilon VanOver, Darrell Fetty, Boyd Holbrook, Andrew Howard, Mare Winningham, Ronan Vibert, Powers Boothe, Kevin Reynolds, Tom McKay, Joe Absolom, Herb Nanas, Tom Berenger, Lindsay PulsipherNoel Fisher, Hatfield and McCoy Productions, LLC, Matt Barr, Jena Malone, Sarah Parish, Bill Paxton, Sam Reid, Kevin Costner, Jilon VanOver, Darrell Fetty, Boyd Holbrook, Andrew Howard, Mare Winningham, Ronan Vibert, Powers Boothe, Kevin Reynolds, Tom McKay, Joe…   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25343070', 'Director': 'Kevin Reynolds', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '4 hours and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 31, 2012', 'Actors': 'Kevin Costner, Bill Paxton, Matt Barr, Tom Berenger, Powers Boothe', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Producers': 'Kevin Costner, Herb Nanas, Darrell Fetty', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'}
I had already seen most of it on TV. But I missed some, so I decided to order it. I loved it. It was really a sad thing that went on, but I enjoyed the movie.
Loved It !!!!!!!

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary**

- **Interests**: The user has a robust interest in historical dramas depicting significant narratives and conflicts, complemented by a clear passion for family-friendly content. Their recent acquisition of children's content indicates a strong commitment to engaging and nurturing experiences for their grandchildren.

- **Media Format Preference**: The user prefers high-quality formats for adult-focused content, as reflected in their choice of Blu-ray for historical dramas. Their recent purchases of DVDs for children's programming illustrate a flexible approach to media formats when it comes to ensuring enjoyable experiences for younger audiences.

- **Engagement with Content**: The user favors engaging with previously viewed content, showcasing a desire to create memorable family moments. Their reviews consistently emphasize the fun and interactive nature of content shared with grandchildren.

- **Emotional Response**: The user exhibits a strong emotional connection to narratives, valuing both thought-provoking themes and simpler, joyful experiences in family entertainment. Their enjoyment of children's music reflects their nurturing personality and commitment to sparking joy in their grandchildren's lives.

- **Rating Behavior**: The user tends to rate content positively, indicating a preference for works that genuinely resonate with them. Their openness to exploring various genres, from historical narratives to family-centric entertainment, underscores their appreciation for meaningful storytelling.

Overall, this profile outlines a film enthusiast who values quality and emotional engagement in both historical and family-oriented contexts, fostering shared experiences through entertainment.
